item.title: 分布式编程第一周课堂笔记
item.description: Introduction to MapReduce Figure1: Introduction to MapReduce Lecture Summary: In this lecture, we learned the MapReduce paradigm, which is a pattern of parallel functional programming that has been very successful in enabling “big data” computations. The input to a MapReduce style computation is a set of key-value pairs. The keys are similar to keys used in hash tables, and the functional programming approach requires that both the keys and values be immutable.
